snippet: The Congress for Jewish Culture, founded in 1948 by a group of Yiddish writers and intellectuals to promote the language and culture, is shutting its remaining office on Broadway and 26th Street in Manhattan by the end of the month.
abstract: Congress for Jewish Culture, founded in 1948 to promote Yiddish language and culture, is shutting its remaining office in Manhattan after losing much of its funding; will donate its collection of Yiddish books, recordings and artwork to other Jewish groups or archives.
lead_paragraph: The Congress for Jewish Culture, founded in 1948 by a group of Yiddish writers and intellectuals to promote the language and culture, is shutting its remaining office on Broadway and 26th Street in Manhattan by the end of the month.

headline.main: A Treasure House of Yiddish Prepares to Close
headline.print_headline: A Treasure House of Yiddish Prepares to Close
